intro: Adenocalymma sessile, commonly known as the narrow-leafed adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Adenocalymma sessile is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
